meanings.definition: A large pile or heap of something, especially waste or debris.
meanings.sent1: The tambaks of old newspapers in the corner need to be recycled.
meanings.sent2: The construction site had tambaks of bricks and cement bags.
meanings.sent3: The tambaks of toys in the playroom made it look like a treasure trove.
meanings.sent4: Her emotions were like tambaks of colorful confetti, waiting to burst out.
meanings.sent5: The tambaks of autumn leaves in the yard created a beautiful sight.

meanings.definition: To pile or stack something in a disorderly manner.
meanings.sent1: Please don't tambaks the books on the table; it looks messy.
meanings.sent2: She tends to tambaks her clothes on the chair instead of hanging them up.
meanings.sent3: He tambaks his excuses one on top of the other until it's hard to believe any.
meanings.sent4: The clutter tambaks in his mind, making it hard to focus on anything else.
meanings.sent5: The dishes tambaks in the sink when no one feels like washing them.
